intro: Souroubea amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian souroubea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
